How to Tell When a Song is a Hit

posted by Pigeons on November 24, 2014 in Features
1
2
3
4
5
6
7
8
9
PreviousShift + ← / NextShift + →

Image via wallpoper.com

By Charles Holmes

There are so many intangibles that go into making a hit. The right singer, producer, feature, lyrics, production, BPM, or video can all have an affect on the popularity of a given song. However, for all the investment of money, time and various other resources, making a song isn’t an exact science. That’s what makes being a music fan exciting.

The fight between knowing a song has the potential to make it and when it actually does is a weird rush of emotions. Radio play and charts are the obvious signs, but they aren’t the only ways to tell that you’re dealing with a hit.
